CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s husband was issued an occupancy voucher ( yaşayış orderi ) to an apartment in GPE on the basis of an order of ORG . On DATE the applicant ’s husband died .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant became aware that the apartment had been occupied by ORG and her family , who were internally displaced persons ( “ ORG ” ) . According to the applicant , despite her numerous demands , the family refused to vacate the apartment .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant lodged a court action with ORG asking the court to order the relevant authorities to change the documents of the apartment into her name and the eviction of PERSON and her family from the apartment . On DATE ORG partly granted the applicant ’s request . The court held that the defendants had no right to use the apartment and that they unlawfully occupied it and ordered their eviction from the apartment . Concerning the changes in the apartment ’s documents , the court held that it was not possible to provide the applicant with the relevant documents as the construction of the building had not yet been terminated . No appeals were filed against this judgment and , pursuant to the domestic law in force at the material time , it became enforceable within DATE after its delivery . However , the ORG family refused to comply with the judgment .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant lodged an action with ORG asking compensation for non - enforcement of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the ORG and on DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request . On DATE ORG upheld the lower courts’ judgments .
CARDINAL . At the time of the latest communication with the applicant , the judgment of CARDINAL DATE in her favour remained unenforced .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
